newsitem.title: UK: Deutsche MG managers may get bonuses - paper.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche MG managers may get bonuses - paper.

text.p: A group of senior managers at London-based investment bank Deutsche Morgan Grenfell are likely to be entitled to multi-million pound bonuses last year despite a loss at its British subsidiary, Monday's Financial Times reported.

The newspaper said some directors might be entitled to gains of several million pounds -- to be paid out over several years and not claimable immediately -- from a phantom option scheme which pays bonuses according to internal performance measures.
It said chief executive Michael Dobson was thought by some executives to have become entitled to some 7.5 million pounds ($12.2 million).
Dobson would not comment on his gain but told the Financial Times "this is a long-term incentive scheme that has served the bank will over several years".
The newspaper said the disclosure could reignite controversy over the salaries and bonuses paid by DMG to hire and retain investment bankers.

Deutsche Morgan Grenfell Group, the main corporate vehicle for DMG, is expected to show a downturn in 1996 following losses on hidden investments in its asset management arm made by Peter Young. Deutsche Bank has estimated total losses from the 'Peter Young affair' at 1.2 billion marks (450 million pounds).
